intro: Lannea microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited lannea, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its thick, rugged bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by spherical, red berries that contain several seeds. Lannea microcarpa is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species in tropical and subtropical regions. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food for various animals and contributing to soil stability.
